long_desc.thetext:
...this way Fennec could dispatch touch events.
Implementing the interfaces shouldn't take too much time, but sending the events via DOMWindowUtils may need a bit more time.
All this should be pref'ed so that desktop Fx doesn't expose any of this to web content.
The event targeting is not quite clear yet in the spec, but we can tweak that in followup bugs.
Actually, would it be enough to implement just the event interfaces now, and add the DOMWindowUtils part later? Matt?
Yes, that would work for us.
The patch is still missing support for onFoo event listeners. New patch with that fixed and tests coming soon.

Comment on attachment 525229 updated
Matt, or anyone, feel free to try this. Hopefully it even compiles.
I posted the patch to tryserver.

Jst, the patch has the changes to nsDOMClassInfo and nsScriptNameSpaceManager to allow us to pref off interfaces. Do those changes look reasonable to you? It is a bit ugly hack to add the mDisabled flag, but other options would probably need quite a bit re-factoring. I'll ask review for this once it has compiled/passed tests on tryserver.
